getAccountsFromTTs

public java.util.Set<? extends Account> getAccountsFromTTs(Member member,
                                                           java.util.Collection<TransferType> allowedTTs,
                                                           TransferType.Direction direction)
gets a Set with accounts belonging to the allowedTTs AND to the member

Specified by:
getAccountsFromTTs in interface AccountService
Parameters:
member - the members whose accounts are checked on this
allowedTTs - the transfer types to be checked
direction - a TransferType.Direction enum.
  • If FROM, only accounts from which the checked transfer types come from are included.
  • If TO, only accounts to which the checked transfer types go are included.
  • If BOTH, both from and to accounts of the transfer types are included.
    Returns:
    a Set with accounts belonging to the member, and containing the transfer types in allowedTTs.

getBalance

public java.math.BigDecimal getBalance(AccountDateDTO params)
Description copied from interface: AccountService
Returns the account balance at a given time point. When the date is null, returns the current balance. Note that the date is always inclusive. If you need an exclusive date, use AccountServiceLocal.getExclusiveBalance(AccountDateDTO)

Specified by:
getBalance in interface AccountService

getBalanceAtTimePoint

public java.math.BigDecimal getBalanceAtTimePoint(Account account,
                                                  java.util.Calendar date,
                                                  boolean inclusive,
                                                  boolean compensateChargebacks)
Description copied from interface: AccountServiceLocal
gets the balance at a point in time.

Specified by:
getBalanceAtTimePoint in interface AccountServiceLocal
date - If the date is null, the present balance will be returned.
inclusive - if true, the date is inclusive: transfers happening at exact this date/time are included in the balance.
compensateChargebacks - if true, the balance is corrected for chargebacks. That means that a balance is returned as if any chargebacked transfer or any transfer which is a chargeback of another, didn't happen.

getBalanceAtTransfer

public java.math.BigDecimal getBalanceAtTransfer(Account account,
                                                 Transfer transfer,
                                                 boolean compensateChargebacks,
                                                 boolean inclusive)
Description copied from interface: AccountServiceLocal
gets the balance at the moment of the specified transfer processing.

Specified by:
getBalanceAtTransfer in interface AccountServiceLocal
compensateChargebacks - if true, the balance is corrected for chargebacks. That means that a balance is returned as if any chargebacked transfer or any transfer which is a chargeback of another, didn't happen.
inclusive - if true, gets the balance AFTER the specified transfer was processed. If false, gets the balance at the moment the specified transfer was about to be processed, so just before the processing.
Returns:

getDefaultAccountFromList

public Account getDefaultAccountFromList(Member member,
                                         java.util.List<Account> allowedAccounts)
Description copied from interface: AccountService
gets the default account of the member from a list of allowed accounts. If the default account is not in this list, it gets the first account in the list. If the list is empty, it returns null.

Specified by:
getDefaultAccountFromList in interface AccountService

getExclusiveBalance

public java.math.BigDecimal getExclusiveBalance(AccountDateDTO params)
Description copied from interface: AccountServiceLocal
gets the balance at a point in time, but with the date/time exclusive. That is: transfers happening exactly on the requested date/time are NOT included in the resulting calculated balance. This behavior is in contrast to getBalance, which always returns the result calculated with an inclusive requested date.

NOTE: this method was included late in a testing phase, just before a release. For future versions, it might be better to just have one getBalance method, and have an extra inclusiveDate field in the AccountDateDTO (which is true by default).

Specified by:
getExclusiveBalance in interface AccountServiceLocal

getRatedStatus

public AccountStatus getRatedStatus(Account account,
                                    java.util.Calendar date)
Description copied from interface: AccountService
gets the AccountStatus with rates included. The normal getStatus methods don't bother getting rates, as it involves several other db tables to be checked, and in 9 out of 10 cases the retrieved status doesn't do anything with them. So use this as an alternative to getCurrentStatus or getStatus in case rates do matter. For the rest, works exactly the same as getStatus.

Specified by:
getRatedStatus in interface AccountService
date - may be null, in which the current date is used.

                               java.util.Calendar date)
Description copied from interface: AccountServiceLocal
Returns the current account status for the given account, with date less than the given date (optionally null, returning the current status})

getStatus in interface AccountServiceLocal

credits - true = credits, false = debits
